description: This course introduces the advanced concepts of toxic and hazardous chemical management issues. Major issues are quantification and characterization, toxicity, impact on human health, state-of-the-art biotechnologies to treat the hazardous chemicals. This course will expose students to the risks faced by water/soil and human beings exposed to toxic and hazardous chemicals generated through various human activities and the selection of bioremediation strategies, their design, operation, monitoring, and case studies.
title: Bioremediation of Hazardous Chemicals in Soil & Water
